etymologies: early 19th century (originally vole-mouse): from Norwegian voll(mus) ‘field (mouse)’

definitions: a small, typically burrowing, mouse-like rodent with a rounded muzzle, found in both Eurasia and North America.

notes.text: Subfamily Microtinae (or Arvicolinae), family Muridae: several genera, in particular Microtus, and numerous species

shortDefinitions: small mouse-like rodent with rounded muzzle
